medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and epigastric pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 30 minutes after eating a meatball approximately 12 hours prior to admission. The pain lasted until morphine was administered at the outside hospital (OSH). Associated symptoms included nausea and vomiting twice. The patient reported similar episodes over the past few months, but with much less intensity and duration, typically lasting only 20 minutes. This episode was noted to be longer and more painful.
